security: Revealing operation details like Operation ANTRUNK X, the re-organization of the ratline to and from Havana, and the use of specific assets such as AMAGREE-1 and AMAKA-1 could compromise ongoing operations and endanger the involved personnel. The communication channel between ANTRUNK-13 and ANTRUNK-19, along with the assessment of infiltration candidates, could be exposed.
summary: A progress report for ANTRUNK operations in November 1964 details preparations for various activities, including the recruitment of ANTRUNK-19, the planning of Operation ANTRUNK X, and the recruitment of radio operator and infiltration candidates, while also outlining operational expenditures.
summary_one_paragraph: This dispatch, dated December 10, 1964, provides a progress report on ANTRUNK operations for the period of November 1-30, 1964; it describes the postponement of ANTRUNK-13's trip to Madrid, progress in recruiting ANTRUNK-19 via an open letter channel through Mexico City, preparations for Operation ANTRUNK X to reorganize the ratline to Havana, recruitment of radio operator and infiltration candidates, directions for ANTRUNK-11 regarding OWVL receivers, and lists operational expenditures totaling $1,939.37, and outlines future plans to mount Operation ANTRUNK X, dispatch ANTRUNK-13 to Madrid, and stage MHAPRON recruiters for infiltration in March 1965.
title: ANTRUNK Progress Report for Period 1-30 November 1964
